title: What is the future of blogging in 2020? - Quora

But in 2020, the picture is different. Now almost everyone spends enough time on theinternet, and many are looking to make some money online. And that’s why blogging has become quite popular these days. This is not the only reasonthough, but one of the core motives. Do you know this? Make Good Friends In our society, we all are surrounded by family, neighbors, and friends. But frankly,speaking how many of them truly understand our feelings and emotions? For many, the number is very less. But when I came into blogging and started connectingwith other bloggers, I found many such like-minded people who understand my feelings,the dream I want to achieve and gradually we started supporting each other to achieveour goals.  I never feel alone now as there are so many good friends who are always supporting meand motivating me to work hard. So, I am sure you will be pumped up after reading this and thinking to start a blog. Thendo not think much as we can always find some time from our everyday busy schedule topursue our passion. But what about the earning potential of blogging? Cheers, Dipak Yadav!

You may be wondering whether right now is a good time to start a blog. Maybe you’re facing unemployment or perhaps you’re looking to create a change or even second income for yourself, and you’re trying to imagine how a blog with passive revenue might help. And while I would like to tell you absolutely – I obviously love to blog and have helped thousands of bloggers get started and make improvements – if I’m being honest, the answer is actually “probably.” You should probably start a blog in 2020. Probably – not because of blogging itself, but more about what’s best for you. Despite claims that no one wants to read long-form content, or that all content will be delivered via video, the fact is, Blogging is still a viable and effective medium for creating content and building an online business, even today.You can follow my guide on “How To Start A Blog” to get help with the technical aspects like setting up hosting or WordPress, but that already assumes you’ve made the decision to go forward. What if you’re still wondering? What if you aren’t sure whether your idea for a blog is really filled with as much potential as you dream it is? Wouldn’t it be nice if you had a checklist or worksheet to help you figure out if your blog plan has merit? For that matter, do you need an actual plan? (Hint: if you want to make money, that means your blog is a business, so yes, you need a business plan.) So to me, the question of ’should you start a blog in 2020’ is answered by taking a close look at your idea for a blog and doing some homework. You need to take the time to research your idea and verify that it has potential, both from an interest and a revenue perspective. Every day people are starting new blogs, new podcasts, new YouTube channels. Some of them find success, yet many fail.
